data.message: Why Can’t Startups and Government Learn to Get Along? --  http://rww.to/K2RAlL
Startups move fast. Government moves slower than slow. This is my experience as someone involved with government and now a startup that has government as clients.
Greg Berry Spot on.  In a startup, a new feature can go live in a week.  In a large company, 3-6 months.  In government, it takes years.
Fail fast is virtually nonexistent at, if not anathema to, government.  The willingness to adapt to change...

Corporate intranets are mostly historical artifacts now. 

What happened?
data.name: What Ever Happened to Intranets?
data.caption: www.readwriteweb.com
data.description: Back in the mid-1990s when the Web was young, corporate Intranets were popping up at companies all over the place. They were usually quick and dirty efforts that often involved off-the-shelf parts and little (if any) programming. The idea was to produce a corporate Web portal that was just for inter...

data.message: They still exist for internal docs and backups. Its just much cheaper and easier to use cloud apps especially if much of your info isn't that sensitive
Except for Yammer. Ugh Yammer.

So what exactly makes you think intranets are dead? The article makes a list of some good stuff, but those are not real competitors of intranets. The package solutions like socialcast mean you need to make a whole corporation adopt a certain user behavior, rather than provide an adequate tool for certain business needs and certain people who may be very different from country to country and from industry to industry.

data.message: With its new release, Foursquare becomes a direct competitor to the current recommendations leader, Yelp. But Foursquare will need to beef up its database of real world reviews, even though it will rely mostly on the implicit recommendations of check-ins.
data.name: Foursquare Takes on Yelp With Recommendations. Our Verdict: Good Start, Not There Yet
data.caption: www.readwriteweb.com
data.description: Today location check-in app Foursquare unveiled a new design for its iOS and Android mobile apps. It now focuses on recommending places for you to go, based on your current location. It's also more social. This is a sensible pivot, but Foursquare is not yet at the place it needs to be.

data.message: In 2012, when many organizations and individuals are foregoing start-up blogs for Facebook pages and Twitter feeds (because these accounts typically get higher traffic, more interaction and better reader retention and they rank MUCH higher in the SERPs than a new blog), it's hard to really believe anyone would think of social media as intangible.

data.name: LinkedIn Confirms Millions of Account Passwords Hacked
data.description:
LinkedIn Confirms Millions of Account Passwords Hacked
LinkedIn Wednesday confirmed that at least some passwords compromised in a major security breach correspond to LinkedIn accounts.
Norweigan IT website Dagens IT first reported the breach, noting that “Two days ago a package on the 6.5 million encrypted passwords posted on a Russian hacker site.
Vicente Silveira, Director at LinkedIn,
